verbalization_techniques.name: measure_size
verbalization_techniques.description: Add specific numbers to quantify the claim
verbalization_techniques.example: 20,000 FILTER TRAPS IN VICEROY!
verbalization_techniques.beginner_example: 47 prompts included in the pack

verbalization_techniques.name: measure_speed
verbalization_techniques.description: Add timeframes to show how fast results come
verbalization_techniques.example: IN TWO SECONDS, BAYER ASPIRIN BEGINS TO DISSOLVE
verbalization_techniques.beginner_example: Get your first product description in 30 seconds

verbalization_techniques.name: compare
verbalization_techniques.description: Show contrast with alternatives
verbalization_techniques.example: SIX TIMES WHITER WASHES!
verbalization_techniques.beginner_example: Instead of 3 hours researching, get answers in 3 minutes

verbalization_techniques.name: metaphorize
verbalization_techniques.description: Make abstract concepts concrete with vivid imagery
verbalization_techniques.example: MELTS AWAY UGLY FAT!
verbalization_techniques.beginner_example: This prompt does the heavy lifting for you

verbalization_techniques.name: sensitize
verbalization_techniques.description: Make the reader feel, smell, touch, see or hear it
verbalization_techniques.example: TASTES LIKE YOU JUST PICKED IT!
verbalization_techniques.beginner_example: Imagine opening your phone to see your first sale notification

verbalization_techniques.name: demonstrate_with_example
verbalization_techniques.description: Show a prime example that proves the claim
verbalization_techniques.example: AT 60 MILES AN HOUR, THE LOUDEST NOISE IN THIS ROLLS ROYCE IS THE ELECTRIC CLOCK!
verbalization_techniques.beginner_example: Sarah used this exact prompt and got her first 3 sales in a week

verbalization_techniques.name: dramatize
verbalization_techniques.description: Show the result in action with emotional impact
verbalization_techniques.example: THEY LAUGHED WHEN I SAT DOWN AT THE PIANO—BUT WHEN I STARTED TO PLAY...
verbalization_techniques.beginner_example: My friends thought I was crazy to start an online store. Then came my first $500 day...

verbalization_techniques.name: paradox
verbalization_techniques.description: State something that seems contradictory but is true
verbalization_techniques.example: HOW A BALD-HEADED BARBER SAVED MY HAIR!
verbalization_techniques.beginner_example: How a non-techie built a store in 48 hours

verbalization_techniques.name: remove_limitations
verbalization_techniques.description: Show what the reader won't have to do/suffer
verbalization_techniques.example: SHRINKS HEMORRHOIDS WITHOUT SURGERY!
verbalization_techniques.beginner_example: Write product descriptions without any copywriting skills

verbalization_techniques.name: associate_with_authority
verbalization_techniques.description: Connect with values or people the reader admires
verbalization_techniques.example: MICKEY MANTLE SAYS: CAMELS NEVER BOTHER MY THROAT!
verbalization_techniques.beginner_example: The same method 8-figure brands use daily

verbalization_techniques.name: show_work_detail
verbalization_techniques.description: Show how much work the product does in detail
verbalization_techniques.example: NOW! RELIEF FROM ALL 5 ACID-CAUSED STOMACH TROUBLES—IN SECONDS!
verbalization_techniques.beginner_example: Handles product research, copywriting, AND ad ideas in one prompt

verbalization_techniques.name: question_format
verbalization_techniques.description: Turn the claim into an engaging question
verbalization_techniques.example: WHO ELSE WANTS A WHITER WASH—WITH NO HARD WORK?
verbalization_techniques.beginner_example: Who else wants their first sale this week?

verbalization_techniques.name: offer_information
verbalization_techniques.description: Promise valuable knowledge or how-to
verbalization_techniques.example: HOW TO WIN FRIENDS AND INFLUENCE PEOPLE!
verbalization_techniques.beginner_example: How to find winning products in 15 minutes

verbalization_techniques.name: tie_authority
verbalization_techniques.description: Connect expertise to the claim
verbalization_techniques.example: BOSS MECHANIC SHOWS HOW TO AVOID ENGINE REPAIR BILLS!
verbalization_techniques.beginner_example: What 7-figure store owners do differently

verbalization_techniques.name: before_and_after
verbalization_techniques.description: Show the contrast between states
verbalization_techniques.example: BEFORE COLDENE A CHILD GOT OVER A COLD AFTER 5 DAYS OF SUFFERING...
verbalization_techniques.beginner_example: Before: 3 hours writing one product description. After: 3 minutes.

verbalization_techniques.name: stress_newness
verbalization_techniques.description: Emphasize that this is new/fresh
verbalization_techniques.example: ANNOUNCING! GUIDED MISSILE SPARK PLUGS!
verbalization_techniques.beginner_example: Just discovered: The AI prompt that's changing product research

verbalization_techniques.name: stress_exclusivity
verbalization_techniques.description: Make it feel rare or special
verbalization_techniques.example: OURS ALONE! PERSIAN LAMB ORIGINALS—$389.40!
verbalization_techniques.beginner_example: The tool nobody's talking about (yet)

verbalization_techniques.name: challenge_reader
verbalization_techniques.description: Turn it into a challenge or test
verbalization_techniques.example: WHICH TWIN HAS THE TONI?
verbalization_techniques.beginner_example: Can you tell which description was written by AI?

verbalization_techniques.name: case_history_quote
verbalization_techniques.description: Use a testimonial or case study
verbalization_techniques.example: LOOK, MOM—NO CAVITIES!
verbalization_techniques.beginner_example: 'I got my first sale 3 days after using this prompt' - New subscriber

verbalization_techniques.name: condense_interchange
verbalization_techniques.description: Replace complex process with simple solution
verbalization_techniques.example: NOW! A RING AND PISTON JOB IN A TUBE!
verbalization_techniques.beginner_example: A complete copywriter in a single prompt

verbalization_techniques.name: symbolize
verbalization_techniques.description: Replace direct statement with parallel reality
verbalization_techniques.example: STARTING NEXT TUESDAY, THE ATLANTIC OCEAN BECOMES ONLY ONE-FIFTH AS LONG!
verbalization_techniques.beginner_example: Product research just got 5x faster

verbalization_techniques.name: connect_mechanism
verbalization_techniques.description: Show HOW it works in the headline
verbalization_techniques.example: FLOATS FAT RIGHT OUT OF YOUR BODY!
verbalization_techniques.beginner_example: AI analyzes 1000 products to find your winner

most_aware.description: Knows product, knows what it does, knows they want it
most_aware.headline_strategy: Just name it and state the deal

product_aware.description: Knows product but not convinced it's right for them
product_aware.headline_strategy: Prove your product is the best with differentiation

solution_aware.description: Knows solutions exist, doesn't know your product
solution_aware.headline_strategy: Start with the solution, lead to your product
solution_aware.example: WHO ELSE WANTS A WHITER WASH - WITH NO HARD WORK?

problem_aware.description: Has the problem, doesn't know solutions exist
problem_aware.example: CORNS? or DO YOU MAKE THESE MISTAKES IN ENGLISH?

completely_unaware.description: Doesn't know they have the problem
completely_unaware.headline_strategy: Cannot mention problem, solution, OR product - use identification
completely_unaware.example: WHY MEN CRACK... or THEY LAUGHED WHEN I SAT DOWN...

stage_1.name: Virgin Market
stage_1.description: You are first. No previous information exists.
stage_1.strategy: Be simple. Be direct. Just state the claim.

stage_2.name: Second Mover
stage_2.description: Direct claim is already being used and still working.
stage_2.strategy: Copy the successful claim but ENLARGE it—drive it to absolute limits.
stage_2.example: LOSE UP TO 47 POUNDS IN 4 WEEKS—OR RECEIVE $40 BACK!

stage_3.name: Mechanism Stage
stage_3.description: Prospects have heard ALL the claims. Mere repetition won't work.
stage_3.strategy: Shift from WHAT to HOW—introduce a NEW MECHANISM.
stage_3.example: FLOATS FAT RIGHT OUT OF YOUR BODY!

stage_4.name: Mechanism Elaboration
stage_4.description: A competitor has introduced a new mechanism producing sales.
stage_4.strategy: Elaborate or enlarge upon the successful mechanism.

stage_5.name: Market Exhaustion
stage_5.description: Market no longer believes in advertising. Glutted by ads.
stage_5.strategy: Shift from promise and mechanism to IDENTIFICATION with the prospect.

dtcnews_market_analysis.reasoning: Readers know they want to make money online, have started looking at Shopify, but are overwhelmed. They don't know our specific products yet.
dtcnews_market_analysis.reasoning_soph: AI + Beginner Ecom is relatively new territory. Direct claims still work, mechanism not required yet.
implications: Don't need elaborate mechanism explanations yet
Start with their problem, lead to our solution
Never assume they know our products

desires.description: Physical, material, sensual wants - sharpen, intensify, give them a goal

identifications.description: The roles your prospect wants to play, personality traits they want to project

beliefs.description: Existing prejudices, knowledge fragments - work WITHIN them, don't fight
dtcnews_beliefs: there must be a faster way
